method.name: GET
method.doc: A list of all available API calls.

method.name: GET
method.doc: A list of permissions pertaining to the authenticated API key.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Creates a new API key

description.text: This parameter is either your company, or a sub-company, in which you are adding a new API key to
This parameter is the e-mail address of a user or group to associate the API key with. This e-mail address does not have to be associated with a COMPANYPROJECTUSER of the company

method.name: POST

description.text: The company, or sub-company, that the API key you are adding pub/sub permissions to is associated with

method.doc: Adds MQTT (pub/sub) permissions to an API key. This allows you to publish and subscribe to messages on device namespaces.

description.text: The API key you are adding pub/sub permissions to
The topic in which you are adding pub/sub permissions to, e.g. {company}/#, or a device namespace, e.g. {company}/{project}/{tag}/{asset}/#
Allows the API key to subscribe, or not, to data published on the specified topic
Allows the API key, and any device associated with it, to publish data, or not, on the specified topic

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The API key you are removing pub/sub permissions from
This is defaulted at MqttTopic
The topic in which you are removing pub/sub permissions to, e.g. {company}/pound, or {company}/{project}/{tag}/{asset}/pound

method.doc: Removes MQTT (pub/sub) permissions from an API key on a specified topicor namespace.

method.name: POST

description.text: The company, or sub-company, that the API key you are adding API permissions to is associated with

method.doc: Adds API permissions to an API key depending on the specified call andcompany ID.

description.text: The API key you are adding URL permissions to
The API call that makes up the URL
The specific path, usually company related, that makes up the URL
Allows the API key to make POST requests, or not, to the URL
Allows the API key to make GET requests, or not, on the URL
Allows the API key to make DELETE requests, or not, on the URL

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The API key you are removing URL permissions from
This is defaulted at ApiUrl
The namespace in which you are removing API permissions from, e.g. {company}/#, or {company}/{project}/{tag}/{asset}/#

method.doc: Removes API permissions to an API key depending on the specified call and company ID.

method.name: GET

description.text: The company, or sub-company, to get information for

method.doc: Lists information associated with a company.

method.name: POST

description.text: The company, or sub-company, associated with permissioning

method.doc: Creates a new company, sub-company, or updates a current company, or sub-company.

description.text: The name of the new company, or sub-company
The ID of the sub-company to update
The ID of the company to update

method.name: GET

description.text: The company ID the project is associated with
The project ID whose infomration to list

method.doc: Lists information associated with a company's, or sub-company's, project.

method.name: POST

description.text: The company ID of the associated project

method.doc: Creates a new project under a given company, or sub-company.

description.text: The name of the new project
The description of the new project
The ID of the project to update

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The company ID the project is associated with
The project ID to delete

method.doc: Removes the given project from the company or sub-company.

method.name: GET

description.text: The company ID the device is associated with
The project ID the device is associated with
Defaults to 100, maxes at 1000
The device ID that we paginate from
Deleted devices, which can stay around depending on the license, can be viewed this way

method.doc: Lists the devices releated to a project.

method.name: POST

description.text: The company ID the device is associated with
The project ID the device is associated with

method.doc: Updates, or adds, metadata relating to a specific device ID.

description.text: The deviceID to update or add metadata to

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Removes a device from a given project by putting it in the "Recycle Bin". Data pertaining to the device will stick around for a period of time, or indefinitely, depending on the license.

method.name: GET

description.text: The company ID the user is associated with
The project ID the user is associated with
The e-mail address of the user

method.doc: Lists the information related to a user in a company or sub-company.

method.name: POST

description.text: The company ID the user will be associated with
The project ID the user will be associated with

method.doc: Adds a user to a given project in a company or sub-company.

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The company ID the project is associated with
The project ID to remove the user from

description.uriparam: email, The e-mail address of the user

method.doc: Removes a user from a given project in a company or sub-company.

method.name: GET

description.text: The bucket, or company/sub-company ID to list files from

method.doc: Lists all the files in a given bucket.

method.name: POST

description.text: The bucket, or company/sub-company ID to upload the file to
The local/remote name of the file
The remote storage path of the file, e.g. /remote/storage/path
Force an existing file to be overwritten
Make the file available for HTTP or torrent download via an S3 URL

method.doc: Uploads a file to a bucket with a 10MB maximum. If the file exists, itwill not be overwritten by default. By default, the file is not publicly available.

method.name: GET

description.text: The bucket, or company/sub-company ID to grab the file from
The remote name of the file
The remote storage path of the file, e.g. /remote/storage/path

method.doc: Downloads a file from our cloud file storage given a bucket and filename, with an optional sub-folder specified.

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The bucket, or company/sub-company ID to delete the file from
The remote name of the file
The remote storage path of the file, e.g. /remote/storage/path

method.doc: Deletes a file from our secure cloud file storage given a bucket and filename.

method.name: POST

description.text: The company ID in the namespace of the device
The project ID in the namespace of the device
The tag in the namespace of the device
The asset in the namespace of the device

method.doc: Publishes data to the platform, e.g. sends data and emulates a device inits entirety.

description.text: The field in the namepsace of the device
key/value pairs to make available in LIVE, HISTORY like a standard device

method.name: POST
method.doc: Publishes data to the platform, e.g. sends data and emulates a device inits entirety, but skips the datatstore.

method.name: GET

description.text: The company ID in the namespace of the device
The project ID in the namespace of the device
The tag in the namespace of the device
The asset in the namespace of the device

method.doc: Lists last known fields and entries sent to the platform for a given device.

method.name: POST

description.text: The company ID in the namespace of the device
The project ID in the namespace of the device
The tag in the namespace of the device
The asset in the namespace of the device
The field in the namespace of the device

method.doc: Adds a new key/value pair to field in LIVE.

description.text: The key/value pair to add to LIVE

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The company ID in the namespace of the device
The project ID in the namespace of the device
The tag in the namespace of the device
The asset in the namespace of the device
The field in the namespace of the device
The specific entry in the namespace of the device to delete

method.doc: Deletes a given record from LIVE data storage. Specifying field deletes the key/value pair, while not specifying it removes the entire entry.

method.name: GET

description.text: The company ID in the namespace of the device
The project ID in the namespace of the device
The tag in the namespace of the device
The asset in the namespace of the device
The field in the namespace of the device
Defaults to max of 1000
To paginate, use this option

method.doc: Lists time ordered historicals record for the given field. prevKey should be used in combination with limit to facilitate paging in your application. Pass in a range of epochs for time-based history search.

method.name: GET

description.text: The company ID in the namespace of the device
The project ID in the namespace of the device
The tag in the namespace of the device
The asset in the namespace of the device
The field in the namespace of the device
The entry in the namespace of the device
Defaults to max of 1000
To paginate, use this option

method.doc: Lists time ordered historical records for the given field's specific entry. prevKey should be used in combination with limit to facilitate paging in your application. Pass in a range of epochs for time-based history search.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Create a criterion. Every rule needs at least one criterion. A criterion can be a part of multiple rules. You can update this criterion at any time. If you have more than one criterion in place, and turn if off, the rule will still work with the other criteria. If the criterion is turned off, and is a part of other rules, those will also ignore the criterion. A criterion maps to the <field>/<entry> of your device.

description.text: This parameter provides the least interference when turning on/off rules firing. If the criterion is false and part of an active rule, it will not be evaluated

This parameter is really defined by the {field}/{entry}; of your device's reporting namespace, which would be {company}/{project}/{tag}/{asset}/{field}/{entry}. If there is a JSON mapping between the protocol and your LIVE data, either the LIVE record can be used or the actual way the device sends data
For non-nested values, this is simply the value associated with the {entry}, and the threshold value for firing a rule
This parameter defines which way the threshold value will be evaluated
This parameter is used for updating, or upserting, a criterion

method.name: GET

description.text: The criterion ID in which to display

method.doc: Get a criterion.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get all criterion.

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The criterion ID in which to delete

method.doc: Delete a criterion.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Create a target. Every rule needs a target. A target can be a part ofmultiple rules. A target only requires one notifcation parameter to be specified.

description.text: This parameter is the e-mail address of the target to be notified via e-mail on rule firing
The standard firing message will be POSTed in key/value pairs to a URL.
This parameter is the phone number of the target to be notified via text-messaging, or SMS, on rule firing. If {sms} is specified, {smsAccessId}, {token}, and {from} must also be specified
One of the provisioned phone numbers given to you by Isidorey
The SMS access ID given to you by Isiodrey
The SMS token given to you by Isidorey
This parameter is used for updating, or upserting, a target

method.name: GET

description.text: The target ID in which to display

method.doc: Get a target

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get all targets.

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The target ID in which to delete

method.doc: Delete a target.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Create a rule. A rule is simply a description, and is the mapping between the device namespace, declared in the topicMapping, and the criteria, declared in the ruleMapping. It can be used to describe single rules or to describe groups of rules with similar criteria.

description.text: This is the name of the rule
This is the description of the rule
This is the email subject of the rule

This parameter allows you to specify the email body of the SMS in 160 characters or less (variable depending on namespace, etc). It will completely override the default SMS message. - replacements for emailSubject, emailBody and smsBody can be defined with the following replacement strings: - @NAMESPACE@ - @RULE@ - @FIELD@ - @OPERATOR@ - @VALUE@

This parameter allows you to specify the message body of the SMS in 160 characters or less (variable depending on namespace, etc). It will completely override the default SMS message. - replacements for emailSubject, emailBody and smsBody can be defined with the following replacement strings: - @NAMESPACE@ - @RULE@ - @FIELD@ - @OPERATOR@ - @VALUE@
This parameter is used for updating, or upserting, a rule

method.name: GET

description.text: The rule ID to display

method.doc: Get a rule.

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The rule ID to delete

method.doc: Delete a rule.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Create a topic mapping. A topic mapping maps a device's namespace to rules. This tells the engine to fire the rule when a matching namespace is active on the platform. You can go as high as the <company>/# attribute, effectivelychecking for a threshold on a criterion for every device that reports data.

description.text: This parameter turns off the entire rule firing. N amount of active criteria associated with this rule will still not be fired. If there are two rules with two different topic mappings that have the same namespace, these will not affect each other
The namepsace in which we will trigger a rule check
This parameter is used for updating, or upserting, a topicMapping

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get all topic mappings.

method.name: GET

description.text: The topic mapping to display based on topic ID

method.doc: Get a topic mapping by ID.

method.name: GET

description.text: The namespace to get in regards to the topic mapping to display

method.doc: Get a topic mapping by namespace.

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The topic mapping ID to delete

method.doc: Delete a topic mapping.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Create a rule mapping. A rule mapping is the final, relational step, between everything we've created so far. Here, we can specify the context in which the criteria get evaluated. Only one target can be specified; to push notifications to multiple targets would be a good use-case for <WEBSERVICE>.

description.text: This specifies the rule to group this mapping with. Being able to change the name and description of the associated rule allows you to adapt and update as well
This specifies a single criterion to be associated with a rule and target
This specifies a single target to be associated with a rule and criterion
This specifies an AND evaluation of criteria1 && criteria2
This specifies an OR evaluation of criteria1 && criteria2
If you want to specify another threshold to evaluate on, you must specify a second criterion
If the target has this attribute available, you can specify an e-mail notification
If the target has this attribute available, you can specify an SMS notification
If the target has this attribute available, you can specify a webservice POST notification
This parameter is used for updating, or upserting, a ruleMapping

method.name: GET

description.text: The rule mapping to display

method.doc: Get a rule mapping.

method.name: GET

description.text: The rule mapping(s) to display based on rule ID

method.doc: Get a rule mapping by rule ID.

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The rule mapping to delete

method.doc: Delete a rule mapping.

method.name: POST

description.text: The name of the new column family, or table
The comparator type of column values can be one of the following: ASCIITYPE, BYTESTYPE, INTEGERTYPE, LEXICALUUIDTYPE, LONGTYPE, TIMEUUIDTYPE, UTF8TYPE, UUIDTYPE

method.doc: Creates a new column family.

method.name: GET

description.text: The name of the column family whose description you want to view

method.doc: Gets a column family's description.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gets all the column families associated with the company ID.

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The name of the column family to delete

method.doc: Deletes a specified column family.

method.name: POST

description.text: The name of the column family to create colum under
The name of the column to create
The comparator type of the column can be one of the following: ASCIITYPE, BYTESTYPE, INTEGERTYPE, LEXICALUUIDTYPE, LONGTYPE, TIMEUUIDTYPE, UTF8TYPE, UUIDTYPE

method.doc: Creates a column that can be searchable in CQL if indexed.

description.text: Specify a true value to make the column searchable in a CQL query

method.name: POST

description.text: The name of the column family where the key is
The name of the row where data is being stored
The time-to-live of the data in seconds
Sends data to a realtime channel as well

method.doc: Posts data to a column family using the specified row.

description.text: An limited amount of key/value pairs that represent data to be stored in the row

method.name: GET

description.text: The name of the column family where the key is
The name of the key to get data from
Specify the limit of the data to be returned

method.doc: Gets data from a column family with the given row key.

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The name of the column family where the key is
The name of the row to delete

method.doc: Deletes all the data under a row. If a GET call is done after this, the key will return with no data.

method.name: DELETE

description.text: The name of the column family where the key is
The name of the row
The name of the key in the key/value pair to delete

method.doc: Deletes a key/value pair under a key.

method.name: GET

description.text: The name of the row key to associate a counter with
The name of the counter

method.doc: Returns the current value of the specified counter.

method.name: POST

description.text: The name of the row key to associate a counter with
The name of the counter
The value to change the counter

method.doc: Increments a counter.

method.name: POST

description.text: The name of the row key to associate a counter with
The name of the counter
The value to change the counter

method.doc: Decrements a counter.

method.name: GET
method.doc: CQL query example: SELECT * WHERE KEY = {rowKey} AND {index} = {value}
